item.title: Field
item.description: Namespace: Rhino.Render.Fields Generic data fields used to add publicly accessible properties to RenderContent.FieldDictionary. These should be created by calling a FieldDictaionary.Add() method on a Render content object. These are allocated after the RenderContent object’s C++ object is created and added to the underlying C++ objects content dictionary, who ever allocates a field is responsible for deleting it so these objects clean up the C++ pointers when they are disposed of.

item.title: FieldDictionary
item.description: Namespace: Rhino.Render.Fields Dictionary containing RenderContent data fields, add fields to this dictionary in your derived RenderContent classes constructor. Get field values using the TryGetdata type methods and set them using the Set() method. public class FieldDictionary : IEnumerable Methods BoolField Add(string key,bool value) Add a new BoolField to the dictionary. This will be a data only field and not show up in the content browsers. since 5.1 BoolField Add(string key,bool value,string prompt) Add a new BoolField to the dictionary.
